name: Risk Analysis and Information System Security Policy
description: Policies on risk analysis and information system security

name: Incident Handling
description: Incident handling procedures including detection response recovery

name: Business Continuity and Crisis Management
description: Business continuity including backup management disaster recovery crisis management

name: Supply Chain Security
description: Security in supply chain relationships including supplier assessments and contractual security clauses

name: Security in Acquisition Development Maintenance
description: Security in acquisition development and maintenance of network/information systems including vulnerability handling and disclosure

name: Effectiveness Assessment
description: Policies and procedures to assess effectiveness of cybersecurity risk-management measures

name: Cyber Hygiene and Training
description: Basic cyber hygiene practices and cybersecurity training including phishing awareness software updates zero-trust principles

name: Cryptography and Encryption
description: Policies and procedures on the use of cryptography and encryption including end-to-end encryption where applicable

name: Human Resources Security Access Control Asset Management
description: Human resources security access control policies and asset management

name: Multi-Factor Authentication and Secure Communications
description: Use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication solutions secured voice/video/text communications secured emergency communication systems

name: National Cybersecurity Strategy
description: Member State strategic document with objectives resources policy/regulatory measures for high-level cybersecurity. Must include governance risk assessment preparedness public awareness.

name: Incident Notification (3-stage)
description: Three-stage reporting: Early warning ≤24h Incident notification ≤72h with initial assessment/severity/impact/IoCs Final report ≤1 month

name: Significant Incident
description: Incident causing/capable of causing: (a) severe operational disruption or financial loss OR (b) considerable material/non-material damage to other persons

name: Coordinated Vulnerability Disclosure
description: CSIRT-coordinated process for reporting/disclosing vulnerabilities in ICT products/services

name: European Vulnerability Database
description: ENISA-maintained database for voluntary disclosure/registration of publicly known vulnerabilities

name: Network and Information System
description: Network/information system electronic communications network information system or network element

name: Cyber Threat
description: Potential circumstance event or action that could damage disrupt or adversely impact network and information systems users or other persons

name: Significant Cyber Threat
description: Cyber threat that if materialised could adversely affect provision of services or negatively affect customers/users
